data.title: Cisco Router Consulting Expertise: Router Planning, Deployment, Management, Upgrades, and Debugging
meta_keywords: Cisco RV Series VPN Series Router Consulting Firm
Cisco CRS Series Router Remote Support
Cisco IOS XR Software Consulting Services
data.meta_description: Progent offers planning and debugging help for Cisco's legacy routers and for Cisco's modern routers such as Cisco 1000 and 4000 Series ISR routers, Cisco Meraki MX Series routers, Cisco ASR 9000 aggregation routers, and Catalyst 8500 Series WAN Edge routers.
data.text:
Today's routers usually incorporate L2 switches, and many modern switches include Layer 3 routing capability. Routers offered by Cisco, the producer of the vast majority of the industry's routers, have improved significantly in function and performance and Cisco now makes a comprehensive portfolio that features routers engineered to meet the needs of users from individual telecommuters to nationwide ISPs.

The most recent Integrated Services Routers released by Cisco have the performance and built-in functionality to manage data voice and video as well as virtualization while at the same time offering high availability, web-based management, easy extensibility, and advanced security and compliance. Cisco's ISR routers allow you to build a solid foundation for an IT environment that can grow seamlessly as you hire more employees, open extra sites, activate additional services, extend your network to customers and partners, and build an expanding mobile user base. Progent's Cisco CCIE network engineers can provide fast and economical online support to assist your company to select, configure, administer, update, and support Cisco's latest router technology and can help you to maintain your legacy routers or migrate non-disruptively to Cisco's current router products.

Cisco Routers for Home and Small Offices and Branch Offices

Cisco's routers for smaller businesses and branch offices provide low-cost and dependable entry-level solutions that allow small groups of users to share safe access to the Internet. All these single-configuration desktop routers feature at least four 10/100 Ethernet ports with Wi-Fi options plus integrated firewall for enhanced security. Built for easy setup, administration, and troubleshooting, Cisco's entry-level routers reduce total cost of ownership by cutting equipment and operational expenses. Progent's remote troubleshooting specialists have in-depth experience providing fast and affordable technical help for small companies to set up and maintain these devices, and Progent's Cisco-certified CCIE network consultants can assist you to determine how Cisco's small office routers can add to the strategic value of your information system.

Cisco ISR 900 Series Integrated Services Routers

Cisco's ISR 900 Series desktop routers are small-footprint, quiet, set-configuration devices designed for small to medium-sized businesses, branch offices, and home offices. These entry-level routers have four managed GE LAN ports and offer Metro Ethernet, LTE, and DSL WAN connectivity. The ISR 900 router family delivers three times the IPsec throughput of Cisco's ISR 800 Series family of routers. All ISR 900 Series routers feature Group Encrypted TransportVPN (GETVPN), DMVPN, FlexVPN, and firewall. VPN performance is as high as 250 Mbps. All models allow up to 50 virtual LANs. Supported dynamic failover technology for business continuity include Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol, Hot Standby Router Protocol, and Multigroup HSRP. Provisioning and management can be done with Cisco CP Express, Cisco DNA Center, and Cisco IOS Software. ISR 900 Series routers do not work with Cisco's SD-WAN solution.

Cisco's ISR 921 router comes with dual GE WAN ports, LTE Cat 4, and an internal power supply. VPN performance is 150 Mbps. Cisco's ISR 926 and ISR 927 routers have external power supplies and feature a single WAN interface, Category 4 LTE, VDSL2 and ADSL2/2+. GE WAN VPN performance for both devices is 150 Mbps. The top-of-the-line Cisco ISR 931 features dual GE WAN and includes an internal power supply. GE WAN VPN performance is 250 Mbps.

Cisco Meraki MX Series SD-WAN Security Appliances

The Cisco Meraki MX portfolio of desktop routers combine software-defined wide area networking (SD-WAN) and cloud-hosted unified threat management (UTM) in a single compact appliance able to support 50 to 200 users. Every MX series appliance needs to be licensed to the Meraki cloud. For sites having several external network options (e.g., MPLS, broadband, cellular), SD-WAN technology allows administrators to assign the WAN connection an app uses or to create performance-based rules to select the preferred connection. Cisco Meraki MX fixed-configuration desktop security appliances share key capabilities including:

Application and identity-based firewalling

Content and web search filtering

PCI-compliant Intrusion Detection and Prevention

Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) with reputation-based filtering

Load balancing to aggregate several WAN links into a single high-speed interface with policy-based Quality of Services, traffic shaping, and fast failover

Works with all IPsec VPN devices and services

USB port for fast 3G/4G failover

Wi-Fi versions of each model have 802.11ac Wave 2 2x2 MU-MIMO

The Cisco Meraki MX64 router provides 250 Mbps firewall throughput, 100 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and supports up to 50 VPN tunnels. The MX64 comes with a GbE RJ45 WAN interface, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 WAN/LAN port, and four GbE RJ45 LAN ports. The MX67 security appliance delivers 500 Mbps stateful firewall performance, 300 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and allows up to 50 VPN connections. The router comes with a GbE RJ45 WAN interface, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 port, and four GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces. The MX68 security appliance provides 600 Mbps firewall throughput, 300 Mbps VPN performance, and supports a maximum of 50 VPN connections. The MX68 comes with two fixed GbE RJ45 WAN ports and 10 GbE RJ45 LAN ports (two with PoE+). The MX75 router provides 1 Gbps stateful firewall performance, 500 Mbps VPN performance, and allows up to 75 VPN tunnels. The MX75 includes a GbE SFP port, two GbE RJ45 WAN interfaces, and 10 fixed GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces (two include PoE+).

Cisco 1000 Series ISR Enterprise Branch Routers

Cisco 1000 and 1100 Series Integrated Services Routers (ISRs) powered by Cisco IOS XE internetworking operating system are a selection of fanless appliances intended to deliver high-performance network connectivity, wireless support, and advanced security for small and midsize businesses, enterprise branch offices, retail outlets, kiosks, and machine-to-machine environments. Parallel processing CPU cores and the ability to run Cisco IOS XE software enable these routers to deliver features consistent with Cisco's complete line of modern Enterprise routers. 1000 and 1100 family ISR routers are offered with 4 or 8 LAN ports and offer Gigabit Ethernet packet forwarding. Available features include PoE and PoE+, zero-touch provisioning, plus a range of built-in or pluggable connections such as LAN, WAN, WLAN, VDSL2/ADSL2+, LTE Advanced wireless, 802.11ac wireless, and SFP. Cisco 1000 family ISR routers work with Cisco's SD-WAN subscription services for transparent multi-cloud access, multilayer cybersecurity, and unified monitoring and management across hybrid network models.

Cisco's rackmount or desktop 1100-4G ISR router includes four integrated GE WAN/LAN ports, integrated 3G/4G LTE wireless with two LTE SMA sockets, and a micro-SIM plug-in slot. Encryption packet processing throughput is 200 Mbps. The 1100-6G ISR router also includes two 1G SFP connections and delivers encryption throughput of 520 Mbps. Cisco's desktop ISR 1101-4P router has four integrated switched GE ports, supports 802.11ac and 3G/4G LTE wireless, and features encryption performance of 280 Mbps. The 1109-2P/4P ISR desktop routers have two or four integrated GE ports and two pluggable 3G/4G LTE wireless ports. Encryption performance is 200 Mbps.

The rackmount or desktop 111x-4P/8P ISR routers include four or eight integrated GE connections (two or four with Power over Ethernet) and support VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G LTE, and 1G SFP. Encryption speed is 280 Mbps. Cisco's rackmount or desktop ISR 1111X-8P router includes eight built-in GE connections (four with POE) and supports SFP. Encryption speed is 340 Mbps. The ISR 112x-8P router features eight GE interfaces with PoE and supports SHDSL, VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G LTE wireless, and SFP. Encryption packet processing throughput is 340 Mbps. Cisco's 1161X-8P ISR router has eight GE connections with Power over Ethernet and provides 3G/4G LTE wireless and SFP Fiber. Encryption performance is 450 Mbps.

Catalyst 8000 Series Branch and WAN Edge Platforms for SD-WAN and Routing

Cisco Catalyst 8000 family of routers are modular devices designed to operate at the enterprise branche and the WAN edge in support of hybrid network environments that can incorporate multiple public and private clouds and cloud-hosted applications. Catalyst 8000 devices use Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN Software and provide scalability, intelligent cybersecurity, and 5G connectivity. Performance is enhanced using custom hardware, a multicore architecture, high port density, and in-line encryption. Cisco's subscription software suites provide ongoing access to the latest SD-WAN technology and allow centralized management with enhanced cybersecurity, application-optimized policies, segmentation, and cloud integration.

Cisco Catalyst 8200 Series Enterprise Branch Edge Routers

Cisco Catalyst 8200 Series routers are upgrades to Cisco's 4300 Series Integrated Services Routers (ISRs), delivering higher IPsec performance and scale, accelerated crypto, plus greater built-in WAN port density. These one-rack unit routers are designed to provide Cisco's Secure Access Service Edge (SASE), SD-WAN and 5G-interface technology to enterprise branch offices and the enterprise WAN edge. Cisco's Catalyst C8200L-1N-4T router includes four CPU cores, enables 500 Mbps IPsec throughput, and permits 1,500 SD-WAN tunnels. Cisco's Catalyst 8200L platform does not support container-based apps. The Catalyst C8200-1N-4T model includes eight CPU cores, delivers 1Gb IPsec throughput, permits 2,500 SD-WAN tunnels, and enables edge computing with existing container architectures. Both appliances come with one Network Interface Module (NIM) slot, one Pluggable Interface Module (PIM) slot, two 1G Ethernet WAN interfaces, and two 1G Ethernet WAN Small-Form-Factor Pluggable ports. 4-port and 8-port 1 Gigabit Ethernet switch NIM modules are supported by both 8200 models.

Cisco Catalyst 8300 Enterprise Branch Edge Routers

Cisco Catalyst 8300 WAN Edge routers are intended to supersede Cisco's 4400 line of ISR Routers, providing Cisco's secure SD-WAN architecture to medium-sized and large enterprise branches looking for high WAN IPSec throughput combined with unified SD-WAN services. Advanced capabilities include 5G wireless support, built-in security, WAN MACSec, enhanced Layer 2 switching, and Deep Packet Inspection with application optimization. Catalyst 8300 WAN Edge routers support edge computing for an in-place container architecture for Cisco UCS-E modules offered on Cisco's 4000 line of ISR appliances. All versions in the Cisco Catalyst 8300 line support 4,000 SD-WAN tunnels and feature dual power supplies for high availability.

The Catalyst 8300-1N1S-6T router is a one-rack unit device that includes 8 CPU cores and delivers 2G SD-WAN throughput and IPsec data rates of up to 1.9Gbps. The unit comes with a single SM plug-in slot, a NIM slot, and six built-in 1-Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces. The Catalyst 8300-2N2S-6T appliance is a two-rack unit model that includes 8 CPU cores and supports 2G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance of up to 1.9Gbps. The device has two SM plug-in slots, two NIM slots, and six built-in 1-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports. The Catalyst C8300-1N1S-4T2X router is a one-rack unit device that has eight CPU cores and offers 5G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance up to 15Gbps. The router includes one a single Service Module expansion slot, a NIM slot, two integrated 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces, and four integrated 1G Ethernet WAN ports. The Cisco Catalyst C8300-2N2S-4T2X router is a 2RU appliance that features 12 CPU cores and offers 5G SD-WAN throughput and IPsec throughput as high as 18Gbps. The appliance includes two SM expansion slots, two Network Interface Module slots, two integrated 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports, and four built-in 1G Ethernet WAN ports. LAN plug-in modules available from Cisco range from a 4-port 1G Ethernet switch NIM module to a 50-port Catalyst L2 switch Service Module.

Catalyst 8500 Aggregation Edge Routers

The Catalyst 8500 Series Aggregation Edge routers are fixed, one-rack unit aggregation models for SD-WAN and colocation deployments. Integrated features include route processor, embedded services processor, plus aggregation hardware for various connection options. IPsec performance is twice that of Cisco's earlier generation ASR1001-X router. Flexible connectivity options include 1GE, 10GE, 40GE, and 100GE WAN ports. These routers include redundant AC or DC power units for improved resilience. Software subscription suites provide continuing access to Cisco DNA Center Software for SD-WAN and routing and offer unified management of cybersecurity, application-aware policies, network segmentation, and cloud support.

The Catalyst C8500L-8S4X Aggregation Edge router is intended to offer a similar experience as Cisco's ASR 1000 appliance. The C8500L-8S4X includes four 1/10GE WAN interfaces and supports up to 20 Gbps aggregate performance. SD-WAN IPsec performance is up to 19Gbps. The Cisco Catalyst C8500-12X router has 12 built-in 1/10GE WAN ports and delivers up to 120 Gbps Cisco Express Forwarding aggregate performance. SD-WAN IPsec throughput can reach 51 Gbps. The C8500-12X4QC aggregation router comes with four integrated 1/10GE WAN interfaces and eight 1-Gigabit interfaces and delivers up to 200 Gbps aggregate throughput. SD-WAN IPsec performance is up to 68 Gbps. Cisco's C8500-20X6C router includes 20 built-in SFP+ ports and six x QSFP+ ports. The C8500-20X6C delivers as much as 500 Gbps Cisco Express Forwarding aggregate performance.

Cisco ISR Generation 2 Routers

Cisco's ISR Generation 2 routers are designed to provide branch offices of large businesses with advanced video and voice applications, virtualization, security, and dependable connectivity. ISR G2 routers introduce a design that protects past investments in modules for older ISR routers and reduces future costs by allowing field installation of additional modules when they become available. Compared to previous ISR routers, Cisco's ISR G2 routers offer 2-7 times more throughput, substantially more, and easier support. All Cisco Integrated Services G2 routers offer gigabit switching and include multi-core CPUs and ultra-fast fabric for faster performance. ISR Generation 2 routers also offer smart power control for improved energy conservation.

A major advance with Integrated Services Generation 2 routers is the IOS Software Universal image which includes all of the Cisco IOS feature sets so that you can rapidly authorize and deploy extra services when required without having to acquire and copy a new IOS image over to yourCisco router. Progent's group of Cisco-certified CCIE network consultants can provide world-class skills to assist your business to design, configure, and maintain multi-site installations of Cisco ISR G2 routers that improve branch office efficiency and cut the price of expansion and maintenance.

Cisco's ISR 800 Series Routers

The 800 Series of ISR routers has been functionally replaced by the higher performance Cisco ISR 900 family but is still widely used. Cisco's comprehensive line of 800 Series ISR routers is made up of desktop, fanless appliances intended for small businesses, branch offices, retail shops, telecommuters, and clients of broadband service providers. A wealth of models in the 800 Series product line have been released with various options over the course of many years. The 881 line of ISR routers suggests the wide selection of options offered within the Cisco 800 product family. Models in Cisco's 881 router portfolio can support converged media networks by delivering voice and video, wireless and data in a single integrated router and switch. Advanced data protection can include encryption, VPN tunneling, firewall, and URL filtering. For survivability, available options for Cisco 881 ISR routers include redundant wide area network connections or support for landline broadband WAN connections like DSL as well as multiple cellular 3G and 4G wireless connections all on a single desktop appliance.

Cisco's 881 of ISR routers allow a broad range of deployment scenarios

The basic Cisco 881 router features a 4-port 10/100-Mbps managed switch with up to 15 Mbps throughput, the ability to handle up to 20 users, 2-port integrated Power over Ethernet, and IPv6 compatibility. The Cisco 881W ISR router supports 802.11g/n Wi-Fi. The 881 SRST router includes 4 FXS ports and 1 FXO port for public-switched-telephone-network (PSTN) failover with Cisco SRST. With a Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE) feature license, Cisco's 881 ISR router supports SIP trunk connectivity as a replacement for outdated Primary Rate Interface (PRI) lines or foreign exchange-office (FXO) voice connectivity to a PSTN service provider. CUBE-based SIP trunks also support offsite call agents in Cisco Call Center deployments.

4000 Series ISR Routers

Cisco's 4000 Line of ISR Routers are compact modular and scalable routers intended for businesses with multiple branch offices and remote users requiring direct communication with private data centers and public clouds via VPNs and the Internet. The 4000 series provides the throughput needed for hybrid WAN environments to accommodate mobile users, cloud services, and HD multimedia applications by utilizing WAN optimization, deep packet inspection, and traffic-management techniques. Models in Cisco's 4000 Series run Cisco's powerful IOS XE software, come in a 1-rack-unit (RU) or 2RU package, can handle as much as 2 Gbps of traffic, and can include up to 3 interface slots, 2 service module slots, 4 integrated 10/100/1000 Ethernet ports, and 8 CPU core integrated server modules. Cisco ISR 4000 models support integrated Gigabit Ethernet, T1/E1, T3/E3, PR1, xDSL and other interfaces. To manage unified communications, the 400o ISR provides comprehensive edge support for policy-enhanced SBC, telephony fault tolerance, and Time Division Multiplexing gateways.

The primary difference between Cisco's 4400 ISR and 4300 Series is dual power supply capability in the 4400 Series, providing a greater degree of availability. The 4321 ISR Router has a 1 RU desktop package with two network interface modules (NIMs), delivers as much as 100 Mbps performance, and can handle 240 Digital Voice and Video Channels. Cisco's 4331 model comes in a 1 RU form factor with two NIMs, delivers as much as 300 Mbps throughput, and allows up to 360 Digital Voice/Video Channels. Cisco's 4351 Integrated Services Router comes in a 2 RU form factor with three NIMs, provides as much as 400 Mbps throughput, and can handle 720 Digital Voice/Video Channels. The dual power supply 4431 Integrated Services Router has a 2 RU form factor with three network interface modules, offers up to 1 Gbps performance, and allows up to 720 Digital Voice/Video Channels. Cisco's fault-tolerant 4431 model features a 2 RU package and includes three network interface modules, offers up to 2 Gbps performance, and allows up to 1200 Digital Voice/Video Channels.

Cisco's Midrange WAN Aggregation Routers and Carrier-class Routers

Cisco's WAN edge and service provider routers offer larger businesses with fast, protected headends to manage satellite office and remote user traffic and to offer ISPs cost-optimized WAN edge solutions. Cisco's WAN aggregation and carrier router product line features the ASR 1000 product line and the 9000 Series Aggregation Services family.

Progent's national team of CCIE certified network consultants have extensive backgrounds helping enterprise businesses and ISPs to design optimal deployments and smooth upgrades of Cisco's WAN edge routers. Progent's GIAC-certified information assurance experts can provide unbiased, third-party security inventory assessments, penetration testing and advanced Security information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions to help enterprises that use Cisco's Aggregation Services Routers to meet industry standards and statutory mandates for network data security and incident reporting. Progent also can provide expertise with Horizon3.ai's NodeZero platform for threat assessment. NodeZero depends on AI technology to streamline the threat evaluation cycle of discovering security gaps in perimeters and inside the internal network infrastructure, recommending repairs, mitigating problems, and confirming fixes.

Cisco ASR 1000 Series WAN Edge Routers

Cisco's ASR 1000 Aggregation Services line of routers is designed to fill the middle of Cisco's midrange products that focus on aggregating services at the WAN edge. ASR 1000 Series WAN Edge routers offer a small footprint, multi-function answer for large businesses requiring branch office service aggregation at supergigabit Ethernet speeds. ASR 1000 Aggregation Services routers incorporate an innovative architecture that mixes on-board acceleration with programmable versatility to offer a rich set of concurrent services while preserving dependable responsiveness.

Cisco's ASR 1000 Series WAN Edge routers include Cisco's proprietary QuantumFlow Processor composed of 40 custom Packet Processing Engines that together can support as many as 160 concurrent processor threads. This multi-processing structure, in conjunction with hardware acceleration for all services, allows the high-end ASR 1006 router to scale up to 128 hardware queues, 32,000 subscribers, 4,000 IPsec VPN tunnels at 10K sessions/second, and 2 million Netflow records. This CPU capability allows ASR 1000 WAN Edge routers to support a broad range of sophisticated services simultaneously in high volume while avoiding performance degradation that might violate adherence to SLAs. These services include IOS Firewall, intrusion-detection services, Network Address Translation, Flexible Packet Matching, and deep packet inspection. The ASR 1000 also allows sophisticated traffic control for performing numerous levels of Quality of Service to a data packet in one pass, enhancing the user experience for high-bandwidth multimedia applications.

Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers

Cisco's ASR 9000 Series Routers are designed as WAN-edge routers for carriers who are required to deliver world-class data, voice and video services to home, business, and mobile customers by providing continual operation, high speed, and application awareness. All models in the Cisco ASR 9000 line of Routers run Cisco's IOS XR, a distributed OS built for continuous uptime. Throughput of Cisco's ASR 9000 portfolio of Routers can be expanded to as high as 96 Tbps per system. the ASR 9000 portfolio of Routers support Gigabit Ethernet, 10 GE, and 100 GE and feature fully redundant fabric and power supply, power entry modules, and fan trays plus backup control planes.

The ASR 9001 platform is a carrier-edge router in a 6 RU form factor that delivers 120 Gbps of nonblocking fabric performance. The ASR 9001 has two bays which can support adapters for 1, 10, and 40 Gigabit Ethernet. The chassis has four 10 Gbit Ethernet SFP+ ports as well as ports for GPS Stratum 1 clocking, BITS, and management. The Cisco ASR 9904 Router has a 6 RU form factor and offers dense 10 and 100 Gigabit Ethernet connections in space-constrained sites. The 4-slot ASR 9094 can support up to 4 Tbps of capacity in a single box. The ASR 9912 Router has a 30 RU chassis with 12 slots slots able to support up to 550 Gbps of throughput. The ASR 9912 Router incorporates 2 route processors and 6+1 Fabric Cards to provide N+1 redundancy.

How Progent's Consultants Can Assist You to Support Cisco Routers

Progent's Cisco certified consultants can assist your company to plan, setup, and maintain a converged business network that can automate operations, lower costs, and accelerate time to positive return on investment. By teaming Cisco integrated services routers with Catalyst switches support and Catalyst and Meraki Wi-Fi wireless expertise, Progent can significantly enhance the strategic value of your integrated network. Progent can provide in-person and off-site support and can provide data center support throughout the U.S.
